item.title: The Tau cannon its not so effective.
item.dc:creator: joshka89
item.description:
Hamguy:

in the original as soon as you hit an enemy they turn into gibs but not in this.

i figured it worked like a directed microwave blast heating up every cell in your body until it couldn’t take anymore then explode.
there is this small lag when you fire its annoying.

also when you crowbar enemies they don’t blow up into gibs, i was disappointing by that.

I was thinking it either shoots Tau Leptons (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tau_lepton)
or less likely that is causes “Shear Stress” on bad guys (denoted as Tau in physical mathematics https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shear_stress)

item.title: The Tau cannon its not so effective.
item.dc:creator: warpedfreeman
item.description:
Disturbulator:

Charged Tau > Glueon Gun > Rocket Launcher
I’ve destroyed:
The Dam Heli
The cliffside Heli
The Surface Tension Tank
The Surface Tension Osprey
The surface Tension APC (#1 & #2)
And obliterated the fuck out of a good many more poor creatures inbetween.

2-3 regular tau shots annihilate almost any Npc, on Hard.
It sounds to me that the OP can’t use gun worth shit.

Im not saying that i cant kill enemies with it, im saying that is not the same performance.

item.description:
Hamguy:

in the original as soon as you hit an enemy they turn into gibs but not in this.

Uhhh with the primary or secondary? If the primary…I played the original at least a hundred times and I never saw that unless I kept firing at their dying body…like a few times. In BM, I found that they died pretty fast but I actually haven’t tried the secondary I would think they would with the secondary fire, but I guess I think of the gun as being more of a laser gun or something. Like highly accelerated radioactive particles being shot in a concentrated beam.

item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
Well enemies only gib if they take an exceptional amount of damage that puts their health into some large negative number at the time of death. Only powerful explosives are able to do that. Also, ragdolls will gib if you do something ridiculous to them after death.

Magnum and shotgun also occasionally gib. And the .50 definitely gibs. Epic fun. :3
